page.title: 02FARMING: APPLEVIEW ORCHARD
page.content: In nine acres of land at {Appleview,}Beacon Alley, the owners grow and sell various types of fruit. They have about 400 apple trees, 200 pear trees, 300 gooseberry bushes, 400 blackcurrant bushes and 4 rows of blackberry bushes. The cost of pesticides and care comes to several hundred pounds per year. {BRIDGE FARM:}This interesting farm along Bagwich Lane has 26 acres, and the farmer rents a further 70 acres at Milk Pan Farm. He keeps 42 Guernsey and Jersey cows. Pigs, mainly saddlebacks, are bred on the farm. The farmer has 142 young pigs, 2 boars and some sows. When pigs are 8 weeks old, they are sold in Salisbury Market. Pigs are well fed on beer from Burt's Brewery, Ventnor! Kale is grown for the cows. Peacocks and guinea fowl wander about the farm.
